what: Planetary Pressures Adjusted HDI Index for all countries
title: Planetary Pressures Adjusted Human Development Index Data
code: library(planetaryhdi) library(ggplot2) library(rnaturalearthdata) library(rnaturalearth) library(dplyr)  # 2022 HDI worldwide  world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf")  # Check that planetaryhdi has the necessary columns if(!all(c("iso3c", "phdi") %in% colnames(planetaryhdi))) {   stop("planetaryhdi must have columns 'iso3c' and 'phdi'.") }  # Join the world data with the planetaryhdi data world_map_data <- world |>    left_join(planetaryhdi, by = c("iso_a3" = "iso3c"))  # Handle any NA values that might have been introduced by the join world_map_data$phdi[is.na(world_map_data$phdi)] <- NA  # Define HDI color palette hdi_colors <- c("#d73027", "#fc8d59", "#fee08b", "#fdae61", "#fdd49e", "#feedde",                  "#d9ef8b", "#a6d96a", "#66bd63", "#1a9850", "#00441b", "#003300", "#001a00",                  "#e0e0e0")   # Plot the map ggplot(data = world_map_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = cut(phdi,                           breaks = c(-Inf, 0.399, 0.449, 0.499, 0.549, 0.599, 0.649, 0.699,                                      0.749, 0.799, 0.849, 0.899, 0.950, Inf),                           labels = c("≤ 0.399", "0.400–0.449", "0.450–0.499", "0.500–0.549",                                      "0.550–0.599", "0.600–0.649", "0.650–0.699",                                      "0.700–0.749", "0.750–0.799", "0.800–0.849",                                      "0.850–0.899", "0.900–0.950", "≥ 0.950")))) +   scale_fill_manual(values = hdi_colors, na.value = "gray90", name = "HDI 2022 Brackets") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "World Planetary Pressures Adjusted HDI (2022)") +   theme(axis.text = element_blank(),         axis.ticks = element_blank(),         panel.grid = element_blank())

what: Effects of Adjusting HDI with planetary pressures
title: Planetary Pressures Adjusted Human Development Index Data
code: library(planetaryhdi) library(ggplot2)  # Ensure the dataset has the necessary columns (hdi and phdi) if(!all(c("iso3c", "hdi", "phdi") %in% colnames(planetaryhdi))) {   stop("planetaryhdi must have columns 'hdi' and 'phdi'.") }  # Create the scatter plot ggplot(planetaryhdi, aes(x = hdi, y = phdi, label = iso3c)) +   geom_point(aes(color = phdi), size = 1) +  # Points colored by phdi values   geom_text(aes(label = iso3c), hjust = 1.5, vjust = 1.5, size = 1.5) +  # Labels for countries   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "HDI vs Planetary Pressures Adjusted HDI (2022)",        x = "Human Development Index (HDI)",        y = "Planetary Pressures Adjusted HDI (phdi)") +   theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 10),  # Adjust axis text size         axis.title = element_text(size = 12),  # Adjust axis title size         legend.position = "none")  # Remove the legend

text: tibble 210 rows 11 variables hdi_rank Rank HDI country Name country hdi Human Development Index (HDI): composite index measuring average achievement three basic dimensions human development?long healthy life, knowledge decent standard living. See Technical note 1 http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2023_technical_notes.pdf details HDI calculated. phdi Planetary pressures-adjusted HDI (PHDI): HDI value adjusted level carbon dioxide emissions material footprint per capita account excessive human pressure planet. seen incentive transformation. See Technical note 6 http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2023_technical_notes.pdf details PHDI calculated. pct_diff_hdi Percentage Difference HDI Planetary HDI (caluclated :  [HDI - PHDI] / HDI) rank_diff_hdi Difference rank PHDI HDI. Expressed Rank(phdi) - Rank(hdi) adj_factor Adjustment factor planetary pressures: Arithmetic average carbon dioxide emissions index material footprint index, defined . high value implies less pressure planet. tco2_per_capita_prod Carbon dioxide emissions per capita (production): carbon dioxide emissions produced consequence human activities (use coal, oil gas combustion industrial processes, gas flaring cement manufacture), divided midyear population. Values territorial emissions, meaning emissions attributed country physically occur. co2_emissions_index Carbon dioxide emissions (production) index: Carbon dioxide emissions per capita (production-based) expressed index using minimum value 0 maximum value 76.61 tonnes per capita. high value index implies less pressure planet. material_footprint_per_capita Material footprint per capita: Material Footprint (MF) attribution global material extraction domestic final demand country. total material footprint sum material footprint biomass, fossil fuels, metal ores non-metal ores. indicator calculated raw material equivalent imports (RMEIM) plus domestic extraction (DE) minus raw material equivalents exports (RMEEX). Per-capita MF describes average material use final demand. material_footprint_index Material footprint index: Material footprint per capita expressed index using minimum value 0 maximum value 140.82 tonnes per capita. high value index implies less pressure planet. iso3c ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code
